result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:57 PM Defendant SARAH E SINGH in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Tracy Ann Paider in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Matthew Goldin appeared for defendant Sarah Singh.  Attorney Goldin requests adjournment to resolve together with another case and review the case.  No objection from the State.  Remove the jury trial from the calendar.  Bond continues.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:15 am.

No alcohol consumption or possession.  Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are.
Jury Trial

10:17 AM Defendant SARAH E SINGH appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Eric Sparr in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of right to counsel.  Missed court dates addressed.  State argues for court to impose a small cash bond.  Court imposes a $250.00 cash bond with same conditions as signature bond.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:55 AM Defendant SARAH E SINGH not in court. Prosecuting attorney Amanda Lynn Folger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant fails to appear for a hearing she called to request.  Bench warrant shall remain active.
